channel.title: Getting a Server going
channel.description:
Hey MoparCraft,
Just making this thread to ask a few questions in regards to running a server. I have absolutley no clue on how to run and maintain a server, but I'm keen on playing a server with my friends and I wouldn't mind if you guys joined too!
Anyways so I was wondering if someone can give me an add on skype and we chat over there.
atm, I know that Bukkit is useful, but I personally have no knowledge on how to use those plug-ins.
Skype: MickEnkebabs

item.title: Getting a Server going
item.dc:creator: @AliAbid AliAbid
item.description:
@AliAbid wrote:

I can help you out, add me on skype:

ali.abid331

Read full topic

item.title: Getting a Server going
item.dc:creator: @Mikeyzzz Mikeyzzz
item.description:
@Mikeyzzz wrote:

[quote=“Vain_, post:4, topic:528693”]check to see if the plugin is compatible with your version on bukkitcraft (on the bukkit website>plugin page)
if so, download the jar file.

place file inside the /plugins/ directory

for example:
http://plugins.bukkit.org/

first plugin = PlayerLauncher
click Download on far right of page
“Filename
PlayerLauncher.jar”
^ download from there ^

place jar inside /plugins/ folder

click ‘Overview’ at top to get plugin’s permissions
set those for the ‘groups’ you created in permissions.yml[/quote]Alright thanks

Read full topic

item.title: Getting a Server going
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

check to see if the plugin is compatible with your version on bukkitcraft (on the bukkit website>plugin page)
if so, download the jar file.

place file inside the /plugins/ directory

for example:
http://plugins.bukkit.org/

first plugin = PlayerLauncher
click Download on far right of page
“Filename
PlayerLauncher.jar”
^ download from there ^

place jar inside /plugins/ folder

click ‘Overview’ at top to get plugin’s permissions
set those for the ‘groups’ you created in permissions.yml

Read full topic

item.title: Getting a Server going
item.dc:creator: @Mikeyzzz Mikeyzzz
item.description:
@Mikeyzzz wrote:

[quote=“Vain_, post:2, topic:528693”]put plugin jar file in the /plugins/ directory.
add permissions + usergroups if needed[/quote]I don’t understand how those plugins work though.

Read full topic

add permissions + usergroups if needed
